mchoice.question: What is the capital city of Australia?
Launceston is the second largest city in which Australian state?
Which state has the famous 'Twelve Apostles' ?
Which is a popular ski resort in NSW?
Which of the following is NOT Australian native animals?
Which city has an extensive tram network?
What is known as 'The Silver City' in Australia?
In which location the war movie 'Thin Red Line' was taken?
Which is NOT true about Uluru ?
mchoice.answer: It is the world biggest monolith located in the centre of Australian continent
It was named 'Ayers Rock' by European explorer William Gosse in 1873
Aboriginal people encourage tourists to climb Uluru
The area contains carvings and paintings by Aboriginal people

mchoice.question: What is so special about Longreach?
mchoice.answer: The place where a blacksmith named Thomas Hiscock found the first gold that triggerred gold rush
The town has an expansive, well-preserved penal colony of Australia's early history
The first commercial flight by Qantas took from this town in 1921
None of these answers are correct
